intro: Anthocephalus chinensis, commonly known as Chinese anthocephalus, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, round berries. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
